alert.note: Alert for Covington; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 4:54PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Covington and Escambia. portions of northwest Florida, including the following counties, Okaloosa and Santa Rosa. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen over the past 30 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Baker, Falco, Wing, Beda, Bradley, Rome, Good Hope, Dixie, Escambia Farms, Blackman, Rock Creek, Parker Springs, Beck, Red Oak, Cannon Town, Carolina, Nubbin Ridge and Stanley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
